nodes.bodyText: this should be an error if file based access tokens is enabled and we're not able to read them from disk.
we should use pathSeparator instead of "/"
make this and other String variables as final as necessary.

no need to create this object and and instead we can just have:
return objectMapper.readValue(tokenFile, AccessTokenResponse.class);
this should be final
any exceptions should be logger as error
we should add more comments here as far what is the expected directory structure otherwise it's not easy to follow why we're keep traversing, etc
this should also be an error
here as well let's make this an error
we should add test cases where we have invalid access tokens on disk and make sure those are correctly handled and skipped by the client

I'm not sure why we're only setting the resolver here and not doing anything else since it means after I do this I also need to call initZtsFileUtil to set the resolver and call preload. So why just within this call we reload the file util object ourselves instead of asking the user to do it.
based on the previous comment for the setAccessTokenSignKeyResolver I don't think we need this function at all.
Let's call it more specific ZTSAccessTokenFileLoader instead of ZTSFileUtil
all of our property names start with athenz.
Instead of defining our path separator we should use File.pathSeparator
we should have both rolesStr and fileName as final
The list given to us might be immutable so we can't just call sort on it. Make a copy of the list and then sort that list.
we should probably just get this property in the constructor and not get it every time in this method

but we still need to make them usable since they're declared as public. so rather than just having a resolver kept as a member variable, we can call the init method again to reinitialize the file utility and you don't need the getAccessTokenSignKeyResolver() at all.
This also gives the client the flexibility for someone who doesn't want to use the conf file but define their own resolver, so that they can do so and pass it to the client.
the unit tests can only be done with the set method . no need for this get method.
